title: Cristiano Ronaldo flaunts muscular body in latest photo from gym
body_text:
Cristiano Ronaldo flaunts muscular body in latest photo from gym
Portuguese football star unlocks new goals for fitness enthusiasts
Portuguese football star Cristiano Ronaldo has just dropped a fascinating picture, showing off his perfectly shaped muscular body, which unlocked new goals for the fitness enthusiasts.
The Portuguese ball player is one of the most searched and adored personalities in the world and frequently treats his admirers with glimpses from his personal and professional life.
In the latest post on his Instagram account, the 38-year-old ball player flashed his flawless abs.
The athlete's well-defined six-packs and quadriceps provided a proof for a perfect diet and a regular workout routine, which make him one of the fittest men.
Ronaldo, who is turning 39 in February 2024, is still at the top of his game as he became the top-scorer of the year 2023 with 53 goals after netting twice during Al-Nassr’s 5-2 over Al-Ittihad on December 26.
After a disastrous 2022 where Ronaldo only managed to bag 16 goals as he had trouble finding consistent game time with Manchester United because he was not greatly favoured by their coach Erik Ten Hag, the five-time Ballon d’Or winner made an astounding comeback, something he is known for, and went all the way to become the top scorer of 2023.
Cristiano Ronaldo in 2023:
- 58 matches
- 53 goals
- 15 assists
Mbappe and Kane can no longer go past Ronaldo as they have played their final matches for 2023 while Ronaldo will play his last game of the year on December 30 against Al-Taawoun.
On the other hand, Erling Haaland is likely to play one game in the year as Manchester City are scheduled to take on Sheffield United on December 30.
Top scorers for club and country in 2023:
Cristiano Ronaldo - 53 goals
Harry Kane - 52 goals
Kylian Mbappe - 52 goals
Erling Haaland - 50 goals
It is worth noting that Ronaldo has played for some of the biggest clubs in the world like Manchester United, Real Madrid, and Juventus where he created history and became a legend in little to no time.
Ronaldo played 438 matches with Madrid where he scored a whopping amount of 450 goals, a record that is likely to remain unbeaten, and provided 131 assists.
With Man United, across his two stints, the forward scored 145 goals and provided 64 assists.
In his 21-year-long career, Ronaldo also won the Ballon d’Or, the highest individual award in football, five times and clinched the UEFA Champions League many times as well.
